page.title: 17SPEECH IN GRASSMOOR.
page.content:
When some of the people around Grassmoor talk it is quite different from the announcer on the B.B.C. "I wo fost and she's got munken." means I was first and she is sulking. "Gee oer elsam smackin thee in." means Stop it or I will smack you. "Weerz tharowd man ?" means Where is your father ?
People in the area often chop off the letters 't' and 'h' from words. "I' i' a bi' 'arder." means Hit it a bit harder.
'Youth' is a word which means friend. "Oreyt youth ?" and "A yer winnin' youth ?" are greetings meaning are you well ? The man spoken to might be seventy years old. The word 'youth' does not always mean young man.
